summary:
Johan has gained his test experience within projects at companies such as Nederlandse Gasunie N.V., Health Insurance companies VGZ and IZA and the Dutch telecom provider KPN Mobile.

For five and a half year in totals Johan has worked for  Gasunie. His first project at Gasunie was a very large project called “Balance in Balancing”.  In the end Johan was also asked to carry out tests for other projects within Gasunie. This allowed him the opportunity to collaborate as a system test specialist on projects such as Meter to Bill 2011, Application Hosting 2.0, Jason BI and Camion. In this way he gained much experience testing Business Intelligence systems and systems like Mecoms based on Microsoft Dynamics AX, in system integration testing, migration testing and Cloud Service testing (Microsoft called “Windows Azure”). 

The months thereafter Johan did some miscellaneous testing activities for Oasys and Camion release 1.1, among other things. At that time he was asked to join the Offline Metering and Allocations team. His responsibility within the team is to plan, prepare and execute the system tests for a number of applications. At this moment the team is busy with the automation of the regression tests in Microsoft TFS and MTM for several of their applications along with the usual operational activities.

Johan likes to work within a team, but he is equally at home working on his own. In his work, Johan always strives towards perfection with a satisfied customer as his ultimate goal. His aim is to produce work of quality and an optimal end result.

Johan’s ambition is to work on challenging and instructive projects, where he can use the experience gained so far, to deliver together with the customer high quality working products.

school.name: Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen

education.field_of_study: Computer and Information Sciences and Support Services

projects.title: Gasunie - Offline Metering & Allocation
projects.description:
After finishing up the Next Releases of Camion, Johan joined the operations team of the Offline Metering and Allocation applications. As of now he still works as part of the team where it’s his responsibility to plan, prepare and execute the system tests as part of the operational release. The team’s biggest achievement so far is the implementation of the functionality of the application SCARS within Cosmos and automating the regression tests of Cosmos and Midas in Microsoft TFS and MTM.

During these years Johan's role shifted from actual testing to being the team lead testing of the Offline Metering & Allocation domain (currently known as the IC Domain). From January 2019 and onwards his focus as a Test Analyst moved to the Vertogas application and the Online Metering & Allocation application.

projects.title: Gasunie - Camion Next releases
projects.description: The first release of Mecoms during the Camion project was followed by five other consecutive projects, naming Camion Next Release, Balancing 2.0, RNB Netverliezen, the September release and the November Release. The releases contained the remaining scope items from the first release along with the implementation of some new market ideas like Balancing 2.0 and Netverliezen. The system integration test team was responsible for the preparation and execution of the tests for each of the new or changed integrations. Most of the integrations that were affected were part of the connection between Mecoms and other applications. The team did also the support of the User Acceptance Test so the users were provided with the latest progress reports and the knowledge of the new functionality and how to access it.

projects.title: Gasunie - Jason: FEP replacement
projects.description: During these next releases of Mecoms Johan was also asked to perform some connectivity tests for Oasys-C and Oasys-T on both the acceptance and production environment. It was his task to perform tests to make sure that Oasys was able to connect to the different environments of some of the physical gas transport applications during several fallback and failover scenario’s. Supporting the User Acceptance Tests was another one of Johan’s tasks during this project. Smoke tests needed to be performed after every release to make sure that the new release on the acceptance environment was of good enough quality to be tested.

projects.title: Gasunie - Camion
projects.description:
Currently Johan is working for N.V. Nederlandse Gasunie again. He worked on a project called Camion where he was part of the System Integration Test team. He was responsible for testing the integrations between newly built and existing systems on the acceptance environment. The main focus of Johan were the integrations between Mecoms and Microsoft BI, two applications that were built during this release. 

After the System Integration Test, Johan also helped with the data migration from SAP-ISU to the new system Mecoms. The data that could not be migrated automatically needed to be migrated manually. Also the data had to be compared and the differences had to be analyzed. In the end every difference was adjusted in order to go Live.

projects.title: TAQA Oil
projects.description:
TAQA is a company in the Energy and Utilization market. They decided to re-use an old gas field and make it operational as a storage facility. As part of this new business model a new administrational system will be built. This system is called Oasis and needs to be tested before it can be deployed to the production environment.

Johan is part of the test team that will be responsible for the functional integration test. He will be preparing test scripts in HP QC that can be executed later on in the project.

projects.title: VGZ
projects.description: VGZ is a Dutch Health Insurance company. Johan was one of the system testers who was responsible for preparing and testing the billing and settling process.

contributors.headline: Test engineer  bij DUO (Dienst Uitvoering Onderwijs)

projects.title: Gasunie - Application Hosting 2.0
projects.description: As part of a cost saving programme, the acceptance and production environments hosted by HP were migrated to Gasunie. A new data center was established allowing for the migration of applications to the new environment. This was done for the test environment first. After that the acceptance and the production environment were migrated. In each of the phases the environment was tested thoroughly. The regression tests for each of the applications were a very important part of this project.

contributors.headline: Genius Tester bij N.V. Nederlandse Gasunie

projects.title: Gasunie - Jason BI
projects.description: Jason BI is the name of a project in which a lot of systems will be created new or replaced in order to either supply the customer with the desired information or to update the current systems to the latest Microsoft Technology.

projects.title: Gasunie - Windows Azure (Transparency)
projects.description: Transparency reports, built during MtB2011, were implemented in the Cloud. The Windows Azure platform was used for this. A complete regression test on the test and acceptance environment was executed to verify that the Transparency reports look and work correctly on the new environment.

projects.title: Gasunie - Meter to Bill 2011
projects.description: The Meter to Bill 2011 project was primarily concerned with Transparency. As a result of changed government regulation all measurement and allocation data must be made publicly available. To this end the Gasunie archive system, Cubulus, was amended. Reporting services were added to enable the publication of Transparency reports on both the GTS website and internal Gasunie Gasport.

projects.title: Gasunie - Balans in Balanceren
projects.description:
As a result of changed government regulation a large number of existing applications were enhanced with new functionality and a number of new applications were added.

Johan worked on two different applications during this project: COMBAT and Gasport.

COMBAT was to replace the then current system NimbusIM. COMBAT is responsible for the gas allocation and network balancing processes. The system tests were to show that the stand-alone functionality was working properly. The allocation process is responsible for assigning gas transported through the Gasunie network to the correct Business Partner (customer/ gas transport company). Based on these allocations COMBAT starts the balancing process. During this process COMBAT determines whether or not the gas network is in balance or who responsible is for a potential imbalance of the network. During the system tests Johan tested the functionality using an automatic test tool that was developed by ATOS. Furthermore this test tool was capable of automatically executing the system test cases during a nightly run. The results of this run was examined by the test team and reported to the project manager. Test data was created using  XML-messages. 
In release 2, the metering process of its predecessor NimbusIM was to be implemented. Release 2 contained primarily all the revision and change requests that could not be implemented in release 1. However the metering service was the largest and most important part that needed to be built and tested. This process ensures that all the measurement data from the gas network is collected and allocated allowing COMBAT to calculate the network gas balance.

Gasport is the portal used by Gasunie internal and external customers to display data stored in backend. Johan was responsible for the Test Analysis and the Test Execution.

projects.title: KPN MCCS - Test Environment Manager
projects.description: MCCS plays a pivotal role in the fulfillment of KPN Mobile processes. To this end a number of MCCS test environments are available, all of which must be maintained. SDMC in Groningen is one of the departments responsible for this maintenance. SDMC is responsible for performance measurements and for test data creation. SDMC is also responsible for several other activities on the test environment.

contributors.headline: Test Analist at Dienst Uitvoering Onderwijs (DUO)
Agile Tester bij Rijksinspectie Digitale Infrastructuur

projects.title: VGZ - No Claim 2007
projects.description: Up to 2007 for the health insurance company IZA implemented its own no-claim policy. However, once the government decided in 2008 to implement a statutory own risk threshold, the no-claim policy was dropped. However, earlier claims or claims still to be received for periods before 2008 still need to be credited. Claims reimbursed in March 2008 have to be recalculated. A system test had to show whether this process was working correctly and how far the letters that were created were correct (content and lay-out.). Johan was responsible for the Test Execution.

profile_positions.description: As of 1 January 2018 Johan works as an internal employee at N.V. Nederlandse Gasunie. As a Test Analyst he’s still responsible for testing the Offline Metering & Allocation applications within the Gasunie IT-environment.
profile_positions.title: Test Analyst

profile_positions.description: After 6 months of working on projects for other clients of Atos, Johan returned to N.V. Nederlandse Gasunie to join a project called Camion. He was asked to join the System Integration Test team. It was their responsibility to test the connections between the brand new application, called Mecoms, and the other applications within the IT-environment of Gasunie.
profile_positions.title: Test Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Johan did several projects for different clients of Atos. Among them were VGZ and IZA, KPN Mobile and Nederlandse Gasunie NV. For Gasunie he was involved in several projects and applications where he had to prepare and execute the system tests and report the progress to the various project managers.

He also worked on a project for TAQA. As a test analyst he was responsible for preparing the test execution by creating test scripts in HP Quality Centre.
profile_positions.title: Test Analyst

profile_positions.description: This assignment involved creating testdata for the testers of KPN and Atos, executing Performance tests and troubleshooting problems regarding to the connection with other systems within the KPN Mobile Test Environment.
profile_positions.title: Test Environment Manager

profile_positions.description: Johan worked on several projects as a Test Analyst. He was responsible for creating test scripts, executing tests and reporting results to the project managers. He performed the system tests and some of the system integration tests for several systemswithin the IT environment of Nederlandse Gasunie N.V. Among them were Combat, Gasport and Cubulus.
profile_positions.title: Test Analyst
